NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
Station KUOM
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis l4, Minnesota
January 4, 1957
Miss Margaret Grant,
Executive Secretary
World Brotherhood
43 West 57th Street
New York 19, H. Y.
Dear Miss Grant:
Thank you very much for the invitation to attend the confer¬
ence, "Removing Roadblocks to World Peace,” on January 9, 10 and
11* This subject interests me personally, and it is also one in
which the National Association of Educational Broadcasters has a
genuine interest* The fact that my friend, Senator Hubert
Humphrey, is among those participating is another reason I should
like to be present.
But unfortunately, my too-busy schedule makes it impossible
for me to attend.
Fortunately, though, we have in New York City in the person
of Seymour N. Siegel, Director of WffltC, an active member of our
Association who is also chairman of our international relations
committee. I should like very much to have Mr. Siegel represent
us, and hope therefore that you will extend an Invitation to him.
Yours sincerely,
Burton Paulu
President
